ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Unilateral conductive hearing loss (Left)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: History of cholesteatoma and mastoidectomy with ossicular chain reconstruction; audiogram confirms conductive loss with normal bone conduction.

ordered_list.rationale_short: Monitor hearing sensitivity in patient with long-standing history of ear surgeries.
Assess speech reception and recognition abilities.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: The patient presents with normal hearing in the right ear and a slight sloping to mild conductive hearing loss in the left ear (250-6000 Hz), sloping to moderate at 8000 Hz. This is consistent with the history of mastoidectomy and ossicular chain reconstruction. Speech recognition is excellent bilaterally.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: Normal hearing sensitivity (0-10 dB HL). Left ear: Slight sloping to mild conductive hearing loss (250-6000 Hz), sloping to moderate at 8000 Hz. Normal bone conduction.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: SRT consistent with PTA (Right: 5 dB, Left: 25 dB). WRS excellent (100%) in both ears.

proposed_items: Continue use of amplification (hearing aid) in the left ear
counseling_actions: Discussed results showing stable conductive loss consistent with surgical history
Confirmed excellent word recognition scores support continued hearing aid use
Advised on hearing protection to preserve inner ear function

escalation.rationale_short: Patient to follow up with otologist as scheduled.
